conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: walls have height/thickness, multiple faces are visible, interior volume reads clearly, and the camera is in an angled/isometric view with the roof removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Convincing wall height/thickness and room volume; clean isometric view and cutaway. Minor issues: some openings/wall terminations look simplified and not fully detailed at corners.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room set is largely present (kitchen, dining, living, bedroom, wash/toilet, stairs), and major outer walls generally match. However, the dedicated entrance/foyer area from the 2D plan is not clearly maintained as a distinct space in the 3D (appears merged into the living circulation), and a few internal wall/door placements are simplified.

interior_elements.notes: Dining set, kitchen cabinetry/appliances, sofa, bed, and toilet are present. Furniture scale/orientation is generally reasonable and placed in plausible corresponding rooms (bed located where Bedroom 1 is in the 2D).

visual_clarity.notes: Clean, readable geometry with consistent materials and good visibility. Deduction for text labels on floors (UI/annotation contamination) and some simplified door geometry.

detected_errors.description: Entrance/foyer area shown in the 2D plan is not clearly preserved as a distinct space in the 3D; circulation near the top-right appears merged/simplified.
Door/opening set does not fully match the 2D: the main entrance door/threshold depiction is unclear or missing, and some interior openings are simplified.
Text labels are present in the 3D render (e.g., room names), reducing presentation cleanliness per rubric.

summary: A valid, clean cutaway 3D conversion with strong volumetric representation, but with some layout fidelity loss around the entrance zone and minor door/opening mismatches plus label contamination.
